RelationalDatabase

Class Relation

  • java.lang.Object
    • RelationalDatabase.Relation

  • public class Relation
extends java.lang.Object
    The Relation encompasses all the properties of a Relation concept from RDBMS like it's atrributes, functional dependecies, keys, normal form etc.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Relation

        public Relation(java.lang.String relation,
                int noOfAttr,
                java.lang.String functionalDeps)
        The initial constructor for the input Relation Attributes and Relation Functional Dependencies.
        Parameters:
        relation - The string representation for the Relation taken as input.
        noOfAttr - The number of attributes.
        functionalDeps - The string representation of all the Functional Dependencies taken as input.

      • Relation

        public Relation(java.util.Set<Attribute> attributes,
                java.util.ArrayList<Attribute> fdLeftSide,
                java.util.ArrayList<Attribute> fdRightSide)
        The initial constructor for the input Relation Attributes and Relation Functional Dependencies.
        Parameters:
        relation - The set of Attributes of the new relation.
        fdLeftSide - The list of Attributes that infer other Attributes.
        fdRightSide - The list of Attributes that are inferred from other Attributes.

      • Relation

        public Relation(java.util.Set<Attribute> attributes,
                java.util.ArrayList<FunctionalDependency> funcDeps)
        The initial constructor for the input Relation Attributes and Relation Functional Dependencies.
        Parameters:
        relation - The set of Attributes of the new relation.
        funcDeps - The list of Functional Dependencies for the relation.
